thread.section_title: Sir Ian McKellen’s Captain Picard facepalm sign at the Women’s March is incredible – Metro
thread.title: Sir Ian McKellen’s Captain Picard facepalm sign at the Women’s March is incredible
thread.title_full: Sir Ian McKellen’s Captain Picard facepalm sign at the Women’s March is incredible

author: Troy Nankervis for Metro.co.uk
title: Sir Ian McKellen’s Captain Picard facepalm sign at the Women’s March is incredible
text:
(Picture: Twitter/Lu Williams) Everyone pack and up head home because Sir Ian McKellen has pretty much won the prize for best sign at the Women’s March. 
The legendary actor stepped out in London on Saturday to join the hundreds of thousands of protesters around the globe who weren’t all that impressed by the inauguration of President Donald Trump.
Ian McKellen turned down a £1 million paycheck to officiate a wedding for a good reason Standing in solidarity with fellow celebrities and marchers, Sir Ian brought along a placard featuring his buddy Patrick Stewart in character as Star Trek’s Captain Picard.
The moment in question features the infamous Patrick Stewart facepalm meme, the universal symbol of frustration and angst.
dreams do come true!!! Feminism & Ian @ianmckellan & Star Trek @SirPatStew what a great situation to stumble into during the Women's March ❤ pic.twitter.com/JePDdxNjFL 
— Lu Williams (@Luluannmay) January 21, 2017 

Sir Ian and Sir Patrick are well known for their long-lasting friendship , and we think Ian is pretty much on the money with finding the image to capture how millions around the world are feeling right about now.

Fans across Twitter were unified with their stamp of approval.
@PatrickWilliams @shxrlocked [applause] that's excellent
— Owen Jacques (@Owenjay) January 21, 2017 


You know @ realDonaldTrump messed up if he pissed off #gandalf and #magneto #xmen #LordOfTheRings #WomensMarch … twitter.com/i/web/status/8… 
— 
Johnnyblueprints (@JohnBlueprints) January 21, 2017 
@ Owenjay @ shxrlocked their bromance puts all others to shame, even @ ObamaBidenMemes 
— 
Patrick Williams (@PatrickWilliams) January 21, 2017 
@ shxrlocked @ joshtpm Dammit, when I'm an old man, I hope I have a friend half as good as Sir Ian McKellen
— 
Timothy Boone (@TCB_TheAdvocate) January 21, 2017 Other celebs at the marches included Charlotte Church, Madonna, Miley Cyrus and Emma Watson .
IAN MCKELLEN IS A LEGEND #WomensMarch pic.twitter.com/EDoS1vURm7 
— lyna (@barnesvans) January 21, 2017 

For more on the showbiz turnout on the day, head over to our celeb round-up here .
